headshotImage.caption: Taskin Ahmed headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Taskin Ahmed headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Kusal Mendis c & b Taskin Ahmed 102 (107b 9x4 1x6 164m) SR: 95.32

dismissalComment.html: just imagine how hard this must have been hit if the bowler had enough time in the world to run back few steps after being hit hard on his followthrough and then complete the catch. Full, Kusal backed away and picked the bones out of it. Taskin is hit on the left shoulder but the ball pops up. For a second, he isn't sure where the ball is, but recovers, looks up, regains his composure and then runs back to complete the catch.

headshotImage.caption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Mahmudullah headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Mahmudullah headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Upul Tharanga run out (Mahmudullah) 65 (76b 9x4 0x6 114m) SR: 85.52

dismissalComment.html: high-full toss down leg - beamer - the square leg umpire calls it a no-ball, and there is a direct hit from Mahmudullah. Tharanga is caught short. He has to depart. This is even bizarre: run-out off a no-ball. Lucky break for Bangladesh. Mushfiq dives full-length to his right and deflects the ball to short fine leg. Tharanga dares to rush across to the other end. Mahmudullah, though, attacks the ball and nails a direct hit at the bowler's end

headshotImage.caption: Asela Gunaratne player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Asela Gunaratne player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Asela holes out to mid-off. Really full and outside off, Asela drives it in the air. Mid-off is inside the circle, Sarkar times his jump well and holds onto a overhead catch

headshotImage.caption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalComment.html: two wickets in two balls. Taskin is on a hat-trick. This is an innocuous full-toss on middle, Lakmal swats or rather flaps it away in the air, midwicket dives full-length to his left and grabs a smart, two-handed catch

headshotImage.caption: Nuwan Pradeep player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Nuwan Pradeep player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Taskin does it. He does a Steve Finn or a Shane Bond. He claims a last-over hat-trick, pulls off a spread-eagled celebration, and sets off on a sprint. Pinpoint yorker, ripping inswinging yorker at 141ks, squeezes under the bat and clatters middle and off. Six wickets in the last five overs

headshotImage.caption: Mehidy Hasan Miraz player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Milinda Siriwardana player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Milinda Siriwardana player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Having dropped Siriwardana in the last over, Mehedi bowls his man. This was a straight ball from around the wicket. Credit to Mehedi for holding this back and holding his composure. Siriwardana goes for a big slog-sweep and does not make contact. Timbaaah

headshotImage.caption: Mushfiqur Rahim headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Mushfiqur Rahim headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Danushka Gunathilaka c †Mushfiqur Rahim b Mashrafe Mortaza 9 (11b 1x4 0x6 10m) SR: 81.81

dismissalComment.html: Three men follow the swirling ball on the leg side. Mushfiq, who has the big gloves, calls for it. Runs after the ball, tumbles, and pouches it safely. This was the cutter again from Mashrafe. Hip-high cutter, going away outside off, 118ks. Danushka does not spot the change-up again. He pulls early and splices the ball over square leg. Mushfiq completes a brilliant catch with the sun squinting into his eyes

dismissalText.commentary: Dinesh Chandimal lbw b Mustafizur Rahman 24 (30b 1x4 0x6 53m) SR: 80

dismissalComment.html: Sri Lanka have reviewed an LBW decision. S Ravi took a long, long time to raise the finger. Maybe they've gone up just because they thought the umpire wasn't certain. The appeal was a very strong one from the bowler and keeper. This is a length ball coming in from wide of the crease, Chandimal walks across the stumps to help it over short fine but is struck in front of the stumps. There was certainly no bat. The ball was in line with the stumps and would've hit middle and leg

headshotImage.longCaption: Mushfiqur Rahim headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Thisara Perera run out (†Mushfiqur Rahim) 9 (6b 1x4 0x6 4m) SR: 150

dismissalComment.html: Mushfiq effects a direct hit and runs out Thisara. The square leg umpire raises his finger. Leg-stump ball, Thisara can't put bat on ball. Grazes the pad and rolls behind to the keeper. Thisara probably thinks it has passed the keeper and strays out of the crease, looking to get to the other end. He has to undo his steps. Mushfiq, removes his right glove, hunts the ball down, and over-arm throws it onto the stumps at the striker's end

headshotImage.caption: Mushfiqur Rahim headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Mushfiqur Rahim headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Dilruwan Perera run out (†Mushfiqur Rahim) 9 (8b 1x4 0x6 9m) SR: 112.5

dismissalComment.html: Mushfiq effects another direct hit, this time he under-arms it onto the striker's end. Dilruwan premeditates by venturing a long way across the off stump. Mustafiz pushes a yorker wide past him. Dilruwan misses it and searches for a bye. He can't get back in time. The ball might have brushed the pad. Mushfiq swoops down on the ball and boom! He has had a great day with the big gloves

dismissalText.commentary: Nuwan Pradeep b Taskin Ahmed 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

commentTextItems.html: Taskin does it. He does a Steve Finn or a Shane Bond. He claims a last-over hat-trick, pulls off a spread-eagled celebration, and sets off on a sprint. Pinpoint yorker, ripping inswinging yorker at 141ks, squeezes under the bat and clatters middle and off. Six wickets in the last five overs

commentPostTextItems.html: 8.45pm That is that. The second ODI has been abandoned in Dambulla. The result now means Bangladesh can't lose the series from here. Sri Lanka can't win the series from here. Sri Lanka, though, can square the series by winning at the SSC. Bangladesh still have a chance to secure their first bilateral ODI series away from home in eight years. That is all we have for you from this game. Do come back for the third ODI on Saturday. Hope the weather is brighter at your end. Goodbye and good night for now.
8.40pm Argh! Proper rain again in Dambulla.
8.15pm Better news from Dambulla. The rain has reduced to a light drizzle.
Rezwan: "4 years back, on 28th March, 2013, the situation was quite similar. SL lost to Bangladesh via D/L method after scoring 300+." --- What a coincidence!
7.45pm It is raining heavily now in Dambulla. 10pm is the official cut-off time.
shashank: "SL have toiled hard to compile 311, rain, please don't spoil Tharanga's 200th ODI."
DanielAlexander: "Do we have reserve day for this ODI series? " --- Nope, no reserve days
7.30pm HRahman: "What's the update Muthu? Starting anytime soon?" --- Still raining in Dambulla. Overs might be docked from 7.50pm
6.50pm It is raining in Dambulla, and the covers are on. The entire ground is being covered.

6.25pm Taskin becomes the fifth Bangladesh player, after Shahadat Hossain, Abdur Razzak, Rubel Hossain and Taijul Islam, to pick up a hat-trick in ODI cricket, but no target of over 300 has been successfully chased down in Sri Lanka. Upul Tharanga, playing his 200th ODI, set it up for the hosts with a fine fifty. Mendis, meanwhile, overcame a scratchy start and sprinted to his maiden ODI hundred. Asela's sparkling cameo then took the team past 300. Be back soon for the chase.
mgHabib: "@TheCommentator: "......chased a target of over 300 in Sri Lanka." - there is always a first time, bud; and who knows this could be the day!!"
Gimhana: "@dawolf, only of the frontline bowlers in this "weak bowling line up" played a few days ago, and Dilruwan is the most experienced spinner in SL's ODI side. SL still firm favorites."

dawolf: "It's an imposing total and 300 has never been chased down in Sri Lanka, but Bangladesh are far from out of this. This is a weak Sri Lankan bowling lineup that Bangladesh comfortably put to the sword just days ago, and an easy pitch where all the proper batsmen managed to get some runs. Much will depend on how the new ball behaves under lights. If Bangladesh can get through the powerplay unscathed I think they have a decent chance here."
Mube: "6 wickets in last 5 overs. That's a collapse but SL have enough."

dismissalText.long: c Mustafizur Rahman b Taskin Ahmed
dismissalText.commentary: Suranga Lakmal c Mustafizur Rahman b Taskin Ahmed 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

dismissalText.long: c Soumya Sarkar b Taskin Ahmed
dismissalText.commentary: Asela Gunaratne c Soumya Sarkar b Taskin Ahmed 39 (28b 4x4 1x6 61m) SR: 139.28

commentPreTextItems.html: Oh dear, there is a dog on the field. Who let the dog out? Mehedi looks to chase it away with his cap. The dog has finally left the field

commentTextItems.html: Asela holes out to mid-off. Really full and outside off, Asela drives it in the air. Mid-off is inside the circle, Sarkar times his jump well and holds onto a overhead catch
leg-stump full-toss, swatted square of fine leg for a boundary. This is a sparkling cameo from Asela
length and outside off, drilled to the covers for one
back of a length cutter outside off, bounces off the surface and defeats the cut

headshotImage.caption: Taskin Ahmed headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Taskin Ahmed headshot

commentTextItems.html: full-toss really wide outside off, Mustafiz can't nail the yorker. Asela reaches out and simply slices it past backward point. This would have been an off-side wide had Asela left it
wide full-toss wide outside off, might have slipped out of the hand. Off-side wide
Asela shuffles across off for a cheeky lap, this looks like the offcutter, bounces up off the elbow and glances the helmet
full-toss, angling across off, opens the face and drives the ball to sweeper cover

dismissalText.commentary: Dilruwan Perera run out (†Mushfiqur Rahim) 9 (8b 1x4 0x6 9m) SR: 112.5

commentTextItems.html: Mushfiq effects another direct hit, this time he under-arms it onto the striker's end. Dilruwan premeditates by venturing a long way across the off stump. Mustafiz pushes a yorker wide past him. Dilruwan misses it and searches for a bye. He can't get back in time. The ball might have brushed the pad. Mushfiq swoops down on the ball and boom! He has had a great day with the big gloves
short cutter, 117ks, grips in the surface, Dilruwan reaches out outside off and stabs it back to the bowler
very full and wider than a set of stumps outside off Taskin asks the batsman to reach out. Carved up and over the covers

headshotImage.caption: Dilruwan Perera player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dilruwan Perera player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.longCaption: Taskin Ahmed headshot

headshotImage.caption: Mashrafe Mortaza headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Mashrafe Mortaza headshot

commentTextItems.html: the batsman steps away outside leg, Taskin chases him with a yorker, dug out to square leg off the inside half
Asela backs away outside leg and belts a full ball to mid-off
leg-stump full-toss, dragged to wide long-on

Dilruwan backs away outside leg, Taskin follows the moving batsman, who swishes and misses. Mushfiq dives full-length to his left but the ball bounces just in front of him and rolls away to the fine leg fence
banged short and outside off, upper-cut away over Mushfiq's head for four

length ball outside off, Asela smites it over the man at deep square leg. We saw plenty of these in Australia. Flat, powerful hit, for the second six of the day. Mashrafe conceded only 30 off his first eight overs. The last two cost 25

dismissalText.commentary: Upul Tharanga run out (Mahmudullah) 65 (76b 9x4 0x6 114m) SR: 85.52

dismissalComment.html: high-full toss down leg - beamer - the square leg umpire calls it a no-ball, and there is a direct hit from Mahmudullah. Tharanga is caught short. He has to depart. This is even bizarre: run-out off a no-ball. Lucky break for Bangladesh. Mushfiq dives full-length to his right and deflects the ball to short fine leg. Tharanga dares to rush across to the other end. Mahmudullah, though, attacks the ball and nails a direct hit at the bowler's end

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Taskin Ahmed headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Taskin Ahmed headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Kusal Mendis c & b Taskin Ahmed 102 (107b 9x4 1x6 164m) SR: 95.32

dismissalComment.html: just imagine how hard this must have been hit if the bowler had enough time in the world to run back few steps after being hit hard on his followthrough and then complete the catch. Full, Kusal backed away and picked the bones out of it. Taskin is hit on the left shoulder but the ball pops up. For a second, he isn't sure where the ball is, but recovers, looks up, regains his composure and then runs back to complete the catch.

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Dinesh Chandimal lbw b Mustafizur Rahman 24 (30b 1x4 0x6 53m) SR: 80

dismissalComment.html: Sri Lanka have reviewed an LBW decision. S Ravi took a long, long time to raise the finger. Maybe they've gone up just because they thought the umpire wasn't certain. The appeal was a very strong one from the bowler and keeper. This is a length ball coming in from wide of the crease, Chandimal walks across the stumps to help it over short fine but is struck in front of the stumps. There was certainly no bat. The ball was in line with the stumps and would've hit middle and leg

dismissalComment.html: Asela holes out to mid-off. Really full and outside off, Asela drives it in the air. Mid-off is inside the circle, Sarkar times his jump well and holds onto a overhead catch

dismissalText.commentary: Milinda Siriwardana b Mehidy Hasan Miraz 30 (30b 3x4 0x6 31m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: Having dropped Siriwardana in the last over, Mehedi bowls his man. This was a straight ball from around the wicket. Credit to Mehedi for holding this back and holding his composure. Siriwardana goes for a big slog-sweep and does not make contact. Timbaaah

headshotImage.longCaption: Mushfiqur Rahim headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Thisara Perera run out (†Mushfiqur Rahim) 9 (6b 1x4 0x6 4m) SR: 150

dismissalComment.html: Mushfiq effects a direct hit and runs out Thisara. The square leg umpire raises his finger. Leg-stump ball, Thisara can't put bat on ball. Grazes the pad and rolls behind to the keeper. Thisara probably thinks it has passed the keeper and strays out of the crease, looking to get to the other end. He has to undo his steps. Mushfiq, removes his right glove, hunts the ball down, and over-arm throws it onto the stumps at the striker's end

dismissalText.commentary: Dilruwan Perera run out (†Mushfiqur Rahim) 9 (8b 1x4 0x6 9m) SR: 112.5

dismissalComment.html: Mushfiq effects another direct hit, this time he under-arms it onto the striker's end. Dilruwan premeditates by venturing a long way across the off stump. Mustafiz pushes a yorker wide past him. Dilruwan misses it and searches for a bye. He can't get back in time. The ball might have brushed the pad. Mushfiq swoops down on the ball and boom! He has had a great day with the big gloves

dismissalText.long: c Mustafizur Rahman b Taskin Ahmed
dismissalText.commentary: Suranga Lakmal c Mustafizur Rahman b Taskin Ahmed 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: two wickets in two balls. Taskin is on a hat-trick. This is an innocuous full-toss on middle, Lakmal swats or rather flaps it away in the air, midwicket dives full-length to his left and grabs a smart, two-handed catch

headshotImage.caption: Taskin Ahmed headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Taskin Ahmed headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Nuwan Pradeep b Taskin Ahmed 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Taskin does it. He does a Steve Finn or a Shane Bond. He claims a last-over hat-trick, pulls off a spread-eagled celebration, and sets off on a sprint. Pinpoint yorker, ripping inswinging yorker at 141ks, squeezes under the bat and clatters middle and off. Six wickets in the last five overs

notes: Sri Lanka innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 48 runs, 1 wicket)

Powerplay 2: Overs 10.1 - 40.0 (Mandatory - 187 runs, 3 wickets)
2nd Wicket: 50 runs in 61 balls (WU Tharanga 24, BKG Mendis 18, Ex 8)
Drinks: Sri Lanka - 85/1 in 16.0 overs (WU Tharanga 39, BKG Mendis 25)
Sri Lanka: 100 runs in 19.5 overs (119 balls), Extras 12
WU Tharanga: 50 off 68 balls (6 x 4)
2nd Wicket: 100 runs in 127 balls (WU Tharanga 51, BKG Mendis 42, Ex 8)
BKG Mendis: 50 off 63 balls (3 x 4, 1 x 6)
Sri Lanka: 150 runs in 27.1 overs (164 balls), Extras 13
3rd Wicket: 50 runs in 34 balls (BKG Mendis 42, LD Chandimal 8, Ex 0)
Drinks: Sri Lanka - 180/2 in 31.0 overs (BKG Mendis 85, LD Chandimal 8)
Over 33.4: Review by Bangladesh (Bowling), Umpire - RR Wimalasiri, Batsman - LD Chandimal (Struck down)
Sri Lanka: 200 runs in 34.6 overs (211 balls), Extras 13
BKG Mendis: 100 off 102 balls (9 x 4, 1 x 6)
Over 36.4: Review by Sri Lanka (Batting), Umpire - S Ravi, Batsman - LD Chandimal (Struck down)
Powerplay 3: Overs 40.1 - 50.0 (Mandatory - 76 runs, 6 wickets)
Sri Lanka: 250 runs in 43.1 overs (260 balls), Extras 17
5th Wicket: 50 runs in 43 balls (DAS Gunaratne 20, TAM Siriwardana 26, Ex 4)
Sri Lanka: 300 runs in 47.6 overs (289 balls), Extras 21
Taskin Ahmed took a hat-trick with the wickets of DAS Gunaratne, RAS Lakmal, N Pradeep.
Innings Break: Sri Lanka - 311/10 in 49.5 overs (KMDN Kulasekara 2)
